# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

We are currently supporting Node.js LTS (Long Term Support) versions for this project. Please refer to the [Node.js Release Schedule](https://github.com/nodejs/release#release-schedule) for current LTS availability.

## Reporting a Vulnerability

We take the security of our project seriously. If you find a security vulnerability in this project, please follow these steps:

1.  **DO NOT** open a public issue or pull request.
2.  **DO NOT** use the public issue tracker to discuss security vulnerabilities.
3.  Please report the vulnerability by sending an email to our security team at `security@example.com` (replace with actual security contact if available).
4.  Please provide as much information as possible, including:
    *   The affected version(s) of the project.
    *   A detailed description of the vulnerability.
    *   Steps to reproduce the vulnerability.
    *   Any proof-of-concept code, if applicable.
    *   Your recommended mitigation or solution.

We will acknowledge your email within **48 hours** and will respond with our triage plan. We appreciate your efforts to help us improve the security of our project.

## Security Practices

This project adheres to the following security best practices:

*   **Dependency Scanning:** Regular scans of project dependencies are performed using automated tools to identify known vulnerabilities.
*   **Code Reviews:** All code changes undergo review, with security considerations being a key aspect.
*   **Secure Defaults:** The project aims to provide secure default configurations where applicable.
*   **Vulnerability Disclosure Policy:** We adhere to a responsible vulnerability disclosure policy to ensure timely and secure remediation.

For more details on our development and security standards, please refer to our contributing guidelines: [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/chirag127/Express-Kickstart-NodeJS-Web-App-Template/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Thank you for helping to keep this project secure!
